qas.question: What group of people were living in the area that would become the Congo prior to the arrival of Bantu tribes?
When did Bantu tribes arrive in the area formerly populated by the Pygmy people?
The Bakongo were a group derived from which tribes?
What language did the Pygmy people speak?
When did the Pygmy people displace the Bantu?
What did the Pygmy people form a basis for?
What Bantu kingdom never traded with the Congo River basin?
What Pygmy kingdom built trade links with the Congo River basin?

context: <a2_0><b3_0>Bantu<b3_0/><a2_0/>-speaking peoples who founded tribes during the Bantu expansions largely displaced and absorbed the earliest inhabitants of the region, the <a0_0>Pygmy<a0_0/> people, about <a1_0><b4_0>1500 BC<b4_0/><a1_0/>. The Bakongo, a Bantu ethnic group that also occupied parts of present-day Angola, Gabon, and Democratic Republic of the Congo, formed the basis for <b5_0>ethnic affinities and rivalries<b5_0/> among those countries. Several Bantu kingdoms—notably those of the <b7_0>Kongo<b7_0/>, the <b6_0>Loango<b6_0/>, and the Teke—built trade links leading into the Congo River basin.
